key_title: Key to the species of Prostanthera

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Lamiaceae

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Calyx-lobes unequal in length; corolla mauve to blue-purple, pinkish, or white, never red, yellow, or metallic blue-green; corolla-tube short, broad distally; abaxial lobe longer and more spreading than the erect adaxial lobes; fruit enclosed by inward folded abaxial calyx-lobe; adaxial calyx-lobe usually recurved (section Prostanthera)

Calyx-lobes more or less equal in length; corolla red (rarely pinkish), yellow, metallic blue-green, never white, mauve to purplish; corolla-tube long, slightly expanded distally; median adaxial and abaxial lobes more or less equal; fruit not enclosed by the calyx-lobes (section Klanderia)
Flowers arranged in obviously terminal racemose or paniculate inflorescences, the floral leaves all or mostly reduced to membranous, usually deciduous, bracteoles
Flowers all appearing axillary, with floral leaves similar to (but sometimes smaller than) leaves on the branchlets
Leaves entire, glabrous (rarely with a few hairs along midrib) with margin entire
Leaves with margin variously toothed, or if ever entire or apparently entire (from recurved margins) then surfaces distinctly hairy
Leaves non-aromatic or only slightly so; lamina narrow- to broad-ovate or oblong, appearing c. linear when margin strongly revolute
Leaves strongly aromatic (when crushed); lamina almost circular
Leaves sessile, to 2 mm wide; calyx 4–5.5 mm long
Leaves petiolate, 3–10 mm wide; calyx 2–3 mm long
Leaves flat
Leaves with margin recurved or revolute
Leaf-apex obtuse to rounded; corolla dark mauve to purple, occasionally pinkish, with markings absent; anther appendages to 0.5 mm long or absent
Leaf-apex acute to acuminate; corolla white to pale mauve with purple spots in throat; anther appendages distinct, c. 1.5 mm long

Erect shrub (to c. 3 m high); petiole to 10 mm long; anther locules with a basal tuft of narrowly triangular trichomes or hairs; leaf-lamina ovate, broadly ovate to obovate or c. circular, to 30 mm long and 15 mm wide

Erect shrub to small tree (1–5 m high); petiole (8–) 10–15 mm long; anther locules with small point basally, lacking trichomes or hairs; leaf-lamina ovate to narrowly ovate, rarely elliptic, 12–50 (–60) mm long, 9–25 (–30) mm wide, with margin usually toothed (rarely entire)
Leaf-lamina ovate, 15–30 mm long, 8–12 mm wide; anther locules with a tuft of basal narrowly triangular trichomes; erect openly branched shrub (2–2.5 m high)
Leaf-lamina broadly ovate to obovate or c. circular, 3–20 mm long, 3–15 mm wide; anther locules with tuft of basal hairs; erect compact to spreading shrub (0.5–3 m high)
Leaves hairy on both surfaces
Leaves glabrous, except for a few short stiff hairs near margin
Leaf-lamina appearing narrowly ovate to narrowly elliptic when margin revolute, rarely appearing ovate, 1.5–6 mm wide; base shortly attenuate; margin entire
Leaf-lamina ovate, 6–13 mm wide; base obtuse to rounded; margin crenate
Leaves convex or with margin recurved to revolute, if ever more or less flat then lamina ovate to obovate
Leaves flat or channelled above, or margins strongly incurved, lamina linear to very narrowly ovate
Leaves more or less terete, oblong (often narrowly so) or linear
Leaves narrowly to broadly ovate, c. orbicular or obovate, never lobed; margin often strongly recurved or revolute
Branches with hairs restricted to area between lateral ridges
Branches densely hairy throughout
Spines absent
Spines present
Leaves narrowly ovate to ovate or obovate, if broadly ovate then usually appearing narrowly ovate because margin revolute (in P. decussata)
Leaves c. orbicular, usually appearing angular-ovate (rhomboid)
Leaves glabrous
Leaves often with upper surface almost glabrous, but always with at least a few short tooth-like hairs near margin
Leaves obovate, 4–8 mm long; bracteoles not persistent, 3–3.5 mm long; strongly aromatic shrub; branches densely covered with short, more or less spreading hairs
Leaves narrowly ovate, 5–15 mm long; bracteoles persistent, c. 2.5 mm long; slightly aromatic; branches sparsely covered with short, appressed hairs between ridges
Stem hairs retrorse to spreading; pedicels less than 3 mm long; calyx greater than 5.5 mm long
Stem hairs antrorse to spreading and/or stems almost glabrous; pedicels usually greater than 3 mm long; calyx less than 5 mm long
Leaves linear, conduplicate or incurved; appearing terete
Leaves flat or slightly channelled above; margin slightly incurved or slightly recurved
Leaf-lamina ovate to narrowly ovate, sometimes suborbicular, never terete or linear-obovate
Leaf-lamina c. linear-terete to -obovate
Leaf-lamina 10–50 mm long; petiole (1.5–) 2–5 (–8) mm long; venation visible, often faint
Leaf-lamina (1–) 1.5–3 (–3.8) mm long; petiole absent or to 0.3 (–0.5) mm long; venation not visible
Bracteoles 10–18 mm long; inner surface of calyx-lobes hairy; leaves non-aromatic
Bracteoles 4–6.5 mm long; inner surface of calyx-lobes glabrous; leaves aromatic
